description: This source file provides functions to read stock symbols for a specified universe, particularly NASDAQ, and to compute the top movers within that universe based on growth percentage. It interacts with external data files, a finance client, and a growth analysis module.

classes.name: AnalyzeGrowthRequest
classes.description: Data class representing the parameters for analyzing growth in stock prices.

classes.name: PriceField
classes.description: Enumeration of different price fields (e.g., close, open) used in analysis.

methods.name: List[str] _read_symbol_file(fname: str)
methods.description: Reads a list of symbols from a specified file within the symbols data directory, removing duplicates while preserving order.

methods.name: List[str] get_universe_symbols(universe: str)
methods.description: Returns a list of stock symbols for a given universe, currently supporting NASDAQ and NASDAQ 100.

methods.name: Tuple[List[GrowthResult],List[str]] get_top_movers_universe( universe: str, start_date, end_date, limit: int, price_field: PriceField | None, client: FinanceClient, )
methods.description: Calculates the top performing stocks within a specified universe over a date range based on growth percentage.

ctags.name: get_top_movers_universe
ctags.signature: ( universe: str, start_date, end_date, limit: int, price_field: PriceField | None, client: FinanceClient, )
